name: Telco Churn Prediction - Retention Optimizer for Business Users
description: A self-service web app that enables telecom business teams to score their latest customer data against a pre-trained churn prediction model, delivering actionable insights for data-driven customer retention.

appStages.name: Introduction
appStages.stageDetails:
{ "components": [ { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "

Telco Churn Prediction â€“ Retention Optimizer for Business Users

Overview

This app enables business users to identify customers likely to churn using a pre-trained classification model. The predictions act as a key trigger to initiate customer retention strategies and improve long-term engagement.

Input

Users provide:

  • + CSV file containing customer data (refer to the schema in the table below)
  • + ML framework to train their model on (e.g., H2O Model)
  • + A custom reference name for the ML model they will train

Output

The app delivers:

  • + Churn predictions for each customer in the uploaded dataset
  • + Segmentation of customers based on predicted churn risk
  • + Insightful metrics to guide targeted retention strategies
  • + Evaluation-ready outputs for business reporting and decision-making

Benefits

  • + Empowers business users to proactively implement retention campaigns.
  • + Assists in improving the effectiveness of marketing and customer service efforts.
", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html", "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "

Data Description

Field Name Description
number_vmail_messages The number of voicemail messages a customer has received. This metric can help assess how often a customer uses their voicemail service.
total_eve_minutes The total number of minutes a customer has used their phone service during the evening period. This can help understand peak usage times and tailor service plans accordingly.
total_night_minutes The total number of minutes a customer has used their phone service during the night period. This metric is similar to evening minutes but tracks usage during a different time slot.
total_night_calls The total number of calls a customer has made or received during the night period. This helps in understanding the volume of night-time usage.
total_intl_minutes The total number of minutes a customer has used for international calls. This is important for customers who frequently call abroad and may require specific international calling plans.
total_intl_calls The total number of international calls a customer has made. This metric complements total international minutes by providing the number of discrete international calling instances.
number_customer_service_calls The number of calls a customer has made to customer service. A high number could indicate issues with the service or the need for better customer support.
intl_plan Whether the customer is subscribed to an international calling plan (usually a yes/no indicator). This helps in identifying customers who have specific needs for international communication.
", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html1", "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "
", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html2", "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "Columns", "columns": [ { "components": [], "width": 6, "offset": 0, "push": 0, "pull": 0, "size": "md", "currentWidth": 6 }, { "components": [ { "label": "Next", "action": "event", "showValidations": false, "theme": "info", "customClass": "btn- rounded mt-0 float-right", "tableView": false, "key": "next", "type": "button", "event": "next", "input": true } ], "width": 6, "offset": 0, "push": 0, "pull": 0, "size": "md", "currentWidth": 6 } ], "key": "columns2", "type": "columns", "input": false, "tableView": false } ] }

Press \u0027Predict\u0027 to perform churn prediction on the uploaded data.\u003c/li\u003e\r\n      \r\n    \u003c/ul\u003e\r\n  \u003c/section\u003e\r\n\u003c/div\u003e",
